medical_history.chief_complaint: Increased headaches and lethargy; presented with mental retardation and intractable epilepsy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until the age of 6 months when a fever of 105ËšF developed, followed by emesis and respiratory arrest. A diagnosis of TSC was established based on calcifications on cranial CT scans. Generalized tonic-clonic seizures developed at 9 months. At 17 years, he experienced increased headaches and lethargy, with MRI revealing increased ventricle size and the size of a SEGA.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC); developed generalized tonic-clonic seizures at 9 months.
medical_history.family_history: Younger brother with neuroblastoma; no family history of TSC.
